edu.monash.fit2099.engine

Class ActorLocations

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.ActorLocations
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Actor>

    public class ActorLocations
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Actor>
    Represents a bimap of locations and actors. Hence it enforces the one actor per location rule. Has a nifty iterator that lets us modify the collection while iterating it.

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Actor player)
        Adds an Actor and identifies it as the player. The player always gets to go first in any turn.
        Parameters:
        player - the player

      • add

        public void add(Actor actor,
                Location location)
        Add a new Actor at the given Location.
        Parameters:
        actor - the Actor to place
        location - where to place the Actor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Actor is already placed or there is already an Actor at the target Location

      • remove

        public void remove(Actor actor)
        Remove an Actor from the system.
        Parameters:
        actor - the Actor to remove

      • move

        public void move(Actor actor,
                 Location newLocation)
        Moves an existing Actor to a new Location.
        Parameters:
        actor - the Actor to move
        newLocation - the Actor's destination
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if another Actor is already at that Location

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Actor actor)
        Returns true if actor exists in the system.
        Parameters:
        actor - the Actor to look for
        Returns:
        true if and only if actor is somewhere in the system

      • isAnActorAt

        public boolean isAnActorAt(Location location)
        Returns true if an Actor is at the given Location.
        Parameters:
        location - the Location to check
        Returns:
        true if and only if an Actor is at the given Location.

      • getActorAt

        public Actor getActorAt(Location location)
        Returns a reference to the Actor at the given location, if there is one.
        Parameters:
        location - the location to check
        Returns:
        a reference to the Actor, or null if there isn't one

        public Location locationOf(Actor actor)

        Returns:
